front.title: SIP for Click-To-Dial-Back and Third-Party Control

abstract.t: SIP can also be used to control calls established by other entities, for example, to have a computer control a PBX or a web server ask an SCP to initiate a call to a standard telephone (''click-to-dial- back''). We refer to the entity initiating the phone call as the controller and the PBX or SCP as the PSTN server.
